page.title: 20UPPER CAMPSFIELD FARM
page.content: Upper Campsfield Farm is owned by the Blakes who keep over 700 pigs and some cattle. They grow potatoes, barley, wheat, grass and a wide variety of self pick fruit and vegetables eg. strawberries, gooseberries, broad beans and peas. Their main crop is barley of which they grow 45.4 hectares. They have access to a great deal of machinery, including combine harvesters, slurry tankers, fork lift trucks, tractors, rotavators, crumblers, drills, harrows and ploughs. Their self pick produce is very popular. On their farm can be found some of Woodstock's many birds including kestrels. The rarest birds of prey, the ospreys and the marsh harriers are found in the Park. Pheasants are found all over the area as they are bred at a near by pheasant farm for shooting.
